intro: Bulbocodium collinum, commonly known as the mountain sandwort, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in early summer, typically from June to July. Its leaves are fleshy and succulent, adapted to thrive in arid or rocky environments. Bulbocodium collinum is often found in alpine meadows and dry slopes, where it contributes to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
